p: Pectin–cadmium sulfide nanocomposite (Pc/CSNC) was synthesized [ 50] at 60 °C in water phase through applying pectin as the connecting bargaining machine. Pc/CSNC showed a significant antibacterial effect against the culture of E. coli. One study [ 51] focused on the synthesis by the sol–gel method of biopolymer-based nanocomposite ion exchanger pectin zirconium (IV) selenotungstophosphate, which showed prospective antimicrobial activity against S. aureus, while the other [ 52] introduced the synthesis, characterization, and applications of a pectin-based zirconium (IV) silicophosphate nanocomposite (Pc/ZSPNC) ion exchanger. Pc/ZSPNC was revealed to have a considerable antimicrobial effect against E. coli and S. aureus.
